com.flowpowered.react.engine

Class CollisionWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.react.engine.CollisionWorld
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicsWorld

    public abstract class CollisionWorld
extends Object
    Represents a world where it is possible to move bodies by hand and to test collisions between them. In this kind of world the body movement is not computed using the laws of physics.

      • findClosestIntersectingBody

        public RayCaster.IntersectedBody findClosestIntersectingBody(Vector3 rayStart,
                                                             Vector3 rayDir)
        Finds the closest of the bodies in the world intersecting with the ray to the ray start. The ray is defined by a starting point and a direction. This method returns an RayCaster.IntersectedBody object containing the body and the intersection point.
        Parameters:
        rayStart - The ray starting point
        rayDir - The ray direction
        Returns:
        The closest body to the ray start and its intersection point

      • findFurthestIntersectingBody

        public RayCaster.IntersectedBody findFurthestIntersectingBody(Vector3 rayStart,
                                                              Vector3 rayDir)
        Finds the furthest of the bodies in the world intersecting with the ray from the ray start. The ray is defined by a starting point and a direction. This method returns an RayCaster.IntersectedBody object containing the body and the intersection point.
        Parameters:
        rayStart - The ray starting point
        rayDir - The ray direction
        Returns:
        The furthest body from the ray start and its intersection point

      • findIntersectingBodies

        public Map<CollisionBody,Vector3> findIntersectingBodies(Vector3 rayStart,
                                                         Vector3 rayDir)
        Finds all of the bodies in the world intersecting with the ray. The ray is defined by a starting point and a direction. The bodies are returned mapped with the closest intersection point.
        Parameters:
        rayStart - The ray starting point
        rayDir - The ray direction
        Returns:
        All of the intersection bodies, in no particular order, mapped to the distance vector

      • getNextFreeID

        public int getNextFreeID()
        Returns the next available body ID for this world.
        Returns:
        The next available id
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the id for the body is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE

      • createCollisionShape

        protected CollisionShape createCollisionShape(CollisionShape collisionShape)
        Creates a new collision shape. First, this methods checks that the new collision shape does not exist yet in the world. If it already exists, we do not allocate memory for a new one but instead we reuse the existing one. The goal is to only allocate memory for a single collision shape if this one is used for several bodies in the world.
        Parameters:
        collisionShape - The collision shape to create
        Returns:
        The desired collision shape

      • removeCollisionShape

        protected void removeCollisionShape(CollisionShape collisionShape)
        Removes a collision shape. First, we check if another body is still using the same collision shape. If so, we keep the allocated collision shape. If it is not the case, we can deallocate the memory associated with the collision shape.
        Parameters:
        collisionShape - The collision shape to remove
